memberdef.definition: const ScriptDict bool Mercury::ChannelVersion EntityPtr Cell::pNearbyEntity
memberdef.name: pNearbyEntity

detaileddescription.para: The constructor for Cell.

parameterdescription.para: The space that this cell is in.
The information associated with this cell.

detaileddescription.para: The destructor for Cell.
This method moves a real entity from this cell to an adjacent cell.

parameterdescription.para: Indicates whether this is a teleport

detaileddescription.para: This method adds the input entity to the cell's internal list of real entities.
It is called from Cell::createEntity and by the Entity itself when it is onloaded.
This method does everything that the cell has to do when a real entity is destroyed. Basically, it just removes it from the map of real entities.
It assumes that the entity's internal 'die' method has already been called.
This method is called to write backup data for real entities on this cell. The cell should back up part of itself each time this is called.

parameterdescription.para: A value in the range [0, period - 1] that increments with each call.
Indicates what the index can go up to.

detaileddescription.para: We want to periodically update the CellApps that we have created ghosts for our reals on, and also offload them there if appropriate.

simplesect.para: True if this cell should be killed, otherwise false.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called when this space wants to be destroyed.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Mercury::Address &srcAddr, const Mercury::UnpackedMessageHeader &header, BinaryIStream &data, EntityPtr pNearbyEntity)
memberdef.name: createEntity

detaileddescription.para: This method creates a new real entity on this cell according to the parameters in 'data'.

parameterdescription.para: The address from which this request originated.
A pointer to a nearby entity to use during entity creation.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns the id of this cell. This id is unique between cells.
This method returns the number of real entities on this cell.
This method sends this entity positions to the cell app manager.
This method returns a map of the real entities on this cell. The map is keyed by their IDs.
This method returns true if this cell is allowed to offload and the app is permitting offloads.
This method enables or disables offloading of entities.
This method enables or disables offloading of entities.
This method tells us to remove this cell from the application.

This method is called by the CellAppMgr to inform us that this cell should be removed. It also sends a list of CellApp addresses. This cell should not be deleted until all these CellApps have confirmed that no more entities are on their way.

This method handles a message from the CellAppMgr telling us that a neighbouring cell has been removed. This CellApp send a message to the cell being removed to inform it that no more entities will be created on it from this app and it is safe to remove.
This method is call by neighbouring CellApps to inform us that it will no longer create any entities in this cell and so it is safe to remove.
This method causes this cell to come back from the dead.
This method is used to notify this cell that a cell application has died unexpectedly.
This method streams on various boundaries to inform the CellAppMgr for the purposes of load balancing.

memberdef.argsstring: (const SpaceEntryID &entryID, const BW::string &name, bool shouldRecordAoIEvents, bool isInitial=true)
memberdef.name: startRecording

detaileddescription.para: This method starts the collection of replay data for this space.

parameterdescription.para: The space data entry ID used to register the recording space data key.
The name to give to the recorder to use to identify this replay data.
If true, then AoI events will be recorded, otherwise they will not be.
If true, indicates that this is the initial script call from the originating CellApp. Otherwise, this is being called in response from space data change.

detaileddescription.para: This method collects this tick's worth of replay data.
This method stops the collection of replay data for this space.
This method ticks profilers on the real entities on a Cell instance.
Static method to get a generic watcher for the class Cell.
This method returns whether this cell is ready to be deleted.
This class is used to represent a cell.
